meanings.definition: Opposition to modern ideas or practices.
meanings.sent1: Her antimodernism was evident in her refusal to use any technology beyond a basic flip phone.
meanings.sent2: The group's antimodernism led them to reject the new educational curriculum.
meanings.sent3: Despite her antimodernism, she couldn't resist the convenience of online shopping.
meanings.sent4: His antimodernism was like a shield against the fast-paced changes of the modern world.
meanings.sent5: The town's antimodernism was so strong that they still relied on horse-drawn carriages for transportation.

meanings.definition: A belief or movement against modernity.
meanings.sent1: The rise of antimodernism in the art world challenged the status quo.
meanings.sent2: Their antimodernism was rooted in a deep respect for traditional craftsmanship.
meanings.sent3: The antimodernism of the group was so extreme that they refused to use electricity.
meanings.sent4: In a world of rapid change, his antimodernism stood out like a beacon of resistance.
meanings.sent5: The antimodernism of the community was a testament to their commitment to preserving the past.

meanings.definition: The rejection of modernism in favor of traditional values.
meanings.sent1: Her antimodernism clashed with the school's push for technological advancement.
meanings.sent2: The village's antimodernism was reflected in their celebration of ancient rituals.
meanings.sent3: Despite his antimodernism, he couldn't resist the allure of modern conveniences.
meanings.sent4: The artist's antimodernism was a bold statement against the trends of the art world.
meanings.sent5: The family's antimodernism was like a time capsule preserving the customs of their ancestors.
